summary: This bill, the Legislative Line Item Veto Act of 2025, amends the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to grant the President the authority to propose the cancellation of discretionary budget authority, items of direct spending, and targeted tax benefits. It outlines procedures for the President to transmit special messages to Congress with proposed cancellations, for expedited congressional consideration of these proposals, and for presidential deferral authority. The bill also defines key terms and establishes guidelines for identifying and treating targeted tax benefits.
